meta.description: federal agencies, departments, and intra-agency subviews

nodes.label: Department of State
nodes.factoid: Conducts foreign policy, manages diplomatic relations, and issues passports and visas.

nodes.label: Department of the Treasury
nodes.factoid: Manages federal finances, collects taxes, produces currency, and enforces financial laws.

nodes.label: Department of Defense
nodes.factoid: Coordinates military operations and national defense through Army, Navy, Air Force, and Marines.

nodes.label: Department of Justice
nodes.factoid: Enforces federal law, prosecutes federal crimes, and provides legal representation for the United States.

nodes.label: Department of the Interior
nodes.factoid: Manages federal lands, natural resources, national parks, and Native American affairs.

nodes.label: Department of Agriculture
nodes.factoid: Supports farming industry, ensures food safety, administers nutrition programs, and manages rural development.

nodes.label: Department of Commerce
nodes.factoid: Promotes economic development, conducts census, manages trade policy, and protects intellectual property.

nodes.label: Department of Labor
nodes.factoid: Enforces workplace standards, collects employment statistics, and protects worker rights and benefits.

nodes.label: Department of Health and Human Services
nodes.factoid: Administers Medicare, Medicaid, public health programs, and social services nationwide.

nodes.label: Department of Housing and Urban Development
nodes.factoid: Develops housing policy, provides rental assistance, and supports urban community development.

nodes.label: Department of Transportation
nodes.factoid: Oversees federal highways, aviation safety, rail systems, and national transportation infrastructure.

nodes.label: Department of Energy
nodes.factoid: Develops energy policy, manages nuclear weapons program, and operates national research laboratories.

nodes.label: Department of Education
nodes.factoid: Establishes federal education policy, administers student financial aid, and enforces civil rights in schools.

nodes.label: Department of Veterans Affairs
nodes.factoid: Provides healthcare, benefits, and services to military veterans and their families.

nodes.label: Department of Homeland Security
nodes.factoid: Protects borders, manages immigration enforcement, coordinates disaster response, and prevents terrorism.

nodes.label: Environmental Protection Agency
nodes.factoid: Protects environment and public health through regulation of air, water, and hazardous waste.

nodes.label: National Aeronautics and Space Administration
nodes.factoid: Conducts space exploration, aeronautics research, and scientific discovery missions.

nodes.label: Social Security Administration
nodes.factoid: Administers Social Security retirement, disability, and survivor benefits nationwide.

nodes.label: Central Intelligence Agency
nodes.factoid: Collects and analyzes foreign intelligence to support national security and foreign policy decisions.

nodes.label: Federal Bureau of Investigation
nodes.factoid: Investigates federal crimes, conducts counterterrorism operations, and provides domestic intelligence.

nodes.label: National Security Agency
nodes.factoid: Conducts signals intelligence, cryptography, and cybersecurity operations for national defense.

nodes.label: Federal Emergency Management Agency
nodes.factoid: Coordinates federal disaster response, recovery assistance, and emergency preparedness programs.

nodes.label: Small Business Administration
nodes.factoid: Provides loans, counseling, and support services to help small businesses start and grow.

nodes.label: Securities and Exchange Commission
nodes.factoid: Regulates securities markets, enforces securities laws, and protects investors from fraud.

nodes.label: Federal Communications Commission
nodes.factoid: Regulates telecommunications, broadcast media, and internet services nationwide.

nodes.label: Federal Trade Commission
nodes.factoid: Protects consumers from deceptive practices and enforces antitrust laws to promote competition.

nodes.label: United States Postal Service
nodes.factoid: Provides mail delivery service to every address in the United States and its territories.

nodes.label: Federal Reserve System
nodes.factoid: Serves as central bank managing monetary policy, financial stability, and banking system supervision.

nodes.label: Office of Management and Budget
nodes.factoid: Prepares president's budget proposal, oversees federal agency performance, and coordinates administration policy.

nodes.label: Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs
nodes.factoid: Reviews federal agency regulations, manages information policy, and coordinates regulatory reform efforts.

nodes.label: Appropriations Committees
nodes.factoid: House and Senate committees responsible for allocating federal spending through annual appropriations bills.

nodes.label: House Judiciary Committee
nodes.factoid: House committee with jurisdiction over impeachment, constitutional amendments, federal courts, and civil liberties.

nodes.label: Congressional Oversight
nodes.factoid: Congressional committees monitoring executive branch activities, agency performance, and program effectiveness.

nodes.label: Chief Justice
nodes.factoid: Head of Supreme Court and federal judiciary who presides over Court proceedings and impeachment trials.

nodes.label: Public
nodes.factoid: General public participating in federal rulemaking through comment periods and public engagement processes.

nodes.label: Federal Agencies
nodes.factoid: Collection of all federal executive branch agencies implementing laws and delivering government services.

nodes.label: State and Local Governments
nodes.factoid: State and local government entities interacting with federal agencies through grants, regulations, and partnerships.

nodes.label: United States Army
nodes.factoid: Land warfare branch with approximately 485,000 active duty soldiers organized into divisions, brigades, and support commands, operating globally under Army command.

nodes.label: United States Navy
nodes.factoid: Naval warfare branch with approximately 350,000 active duty personnel operating 290+ ships, 11 aircraft carriers, and submarine forces across global fleets.

nodes.label: United States Air Force
nodes.factoid: Air and space warfare branch with approximately 330,000 active duty airmen operating fighter jets, bombers, cargo aircraft, satellites, and missile systems worldwide.

nodes.label: United States Marine Corps
nodes.factoid: Rapid deployment amphibious warfare force with approximately 185,000 active duty Marines organized into expeditionary units operating from naval vessels and bases.

nodes.label: United States Space Force
nodes.factoid: Newest military branch established in 2019 with approximately 8,600 guardians operating satellites, missile warning systems, and space domain awareness globally.

nodes.label: Bureau of Consular Affairs
nodes.factoid: Issues over 20 million passports annually, provides consular services to Americans abroad through 270+ embassies and consulates, and manages visa processing.

nodes.label: Bureau of Diplomatic Security
nodes.factoid: Protects diplomats, embassies, and classified information worldwide, conducts security clearance investigations, and coordinates security at over 275 diplomatic facilities.

nodes.label: Bureau of Political Affairs
nodes.factoid: Manages bilateral political relationships, analyzes foreign political developments, and coordinates policy across regional bureaus covering every nation worldwide.

nodes.label: Bureau of Economic and Business Affairs
nodes.factoid: Advances U.S. economic interests abroad, negotiates trade agreements, promotes American business, and coordinates sanctions and economic policy globally.

nodes.label: Internal Revenue Service
nodes.factoid: Collects over $4 trillion in federal tax revenue annually, processes 150+ million individual returns, enforces tax law, and operates nationwide service centers.

nodes.label: Bureau of the Fiscal Service
nodes.factoid: Manages federal government's finances including payments, collections, debt issuance, and accounting for over $6 trillion in annual transactions.

nodes.label: United States Mint
nodes.factoid: Produces all U.S. coins for circulation and collectors, operates six facilities manufacturing billions of coins annually, and manages bullion reserves.

nodes.label: Bureau of Engraving and Printing
nodes.factoid: Designs and prints U.S. currency, producing billions of Federal Reserve notes annually at facilities in Washington, D.C. and Fort Worth, Texas.

nodes.label: Federal Bureau of Investigation
nodes.factoid: Principal federal investigative agency with 35,000 employees conducting criminal investigations, counterterrorism, counterintelligence, and cybercrime operations nationwide.

nodes.label: Drug Enforcement Administration
nodes.factoid: Enforces federal drug laws, combats drug trafficking organizations, coordinates with international partners, and operates in 69 countries worldwide.

nodes.label: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives
nodes.factoid: Regulates firearms and explosives commerce, investigates gun trafficking, arson, and bombings, and enforces federal firearms laws through 25 field divisions.

nodes.label: United States Marshals Service
nodes.factoid: Provides judicial security, apprehends fugitives, transports federal prisoners, manages witness protection program, and executes federal court orders nationwide.

nodes.label: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
nodes.factoid: Protects public health through disease surveillance, outbreak investigation, immunization programs, and health promotion serving entire U.S. population from Atlanta headquarters.

nodes.label: Food and Drug Administration
nodes.factoid: Regulates food safety, prescription drugs, medical devices, vaccines, and tobacco products, overseeing $2.7 trillion in products affecting American health and safety.

nodes.label: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
nodes.factoid: Administers Medicare, Medicaid, and health insurance marketplaces serving over 150 million Americans with healthcare coverage and $1.4 trillion in annual spending.

nodes.label: National Institutes of Health
nodes.factoid: Primary federal biomedical research agency with $47 billion budget funding medical research through 27 institutes studying diseases, treatments, and health nationwide.

nodes.label: Office of Elementary and Secondary Education
nodes.factoid: Administers federal programs supporting K-12 education including Title I funding for disadvantaged students, serving 50 million public school students nationwide.

nodes.label: Office of Postsecondary Education
nodes.factoid: Manages federal student aid programs including Pell Grants and loans, accreditation oversight, and higher education initiatives serving 20 million college students.

nodes.label: Office of Special Education and Rehabilitative Services
nodes.factoid: Ensures IDEA compliance, provides funding for special education services, and supports 7.5 million students with disabilities in schools nationwide.

nodes.label: Office for Civil Rights
nodes.factoid: Enforces federal civil rights laws in education, investigates discrimination complaints, ensures equal access, and protects students from harassment and bias.

nodes.label: Federal Highway Administration
nodes.factoid: Provides federal funding for highways, administers $50+ billion annually for interstate and highway programs, and sets safety standards for 4 million miles of roads.

nodes.label: Federal Transit Administration
nodes.factoid: Funds public transportation systems, provides capital and operating grants to transit agencies, supporting subways, buses, and light rail serving millions of daily riders.

nodes.label: Federal Aviation Administration
nodes.factoid: Regulates civil aviation safety, manages air traffic control system handling 45,000+ daily flights, certifies aircraft and pilots, and operates nationwide airspace.

nodes.label: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration
nodes.factoid: Sets vehicle safety standards, investigates defects, conducts crash testing, manages recalls, and works to reduce traffic fatalities on American roads.

nodes.label: Federal Emergency Management Agency
nodes.factoid: Coordinates federal disaster response, provides disaster relief funding, manages National Flood Insurance Program, and supports state/local emergency management nationwide.

nodes.label: Customs and Border Protection
nodes.factoid: Secures borders at 328 ports of entry, processes international travelers and trade, employs 60,000+ agents and officers managing land, air, and sea borders.

nodes.label: Immigration and Customs Enforcement
nodes.factoid: Enforces immigration laws, investigates cross-border crime, manages detention facilities, and conducts interior immigration enforcement operations nationwide.

nodes.label: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services
nodes.factoid: Processes immigration applications including green cards, naturalization, work permits, and asylum requests, serving millions of applicants annually through service centers.

nodes.label: United States Secret Service
nodes.factoid: Protects President, Vice President, visiting heads of state, and investigates financial crimes including counterfeiting and cybercrime with 7,000+ employees.

nodes.label: Office of Air and Radiation
nodes.factoid: Develops and enforces air quality standards, regulates emissions from vehicles and industry, manages Clean Air Act programs protecting public health nationwide.

nodes.label: Office of Water
nodes.factoid: Protects drinking water quality, regulates water pollution through Clean Water Act permits, and oversees wastewater treatment standards for 150,000+ public water systems.

nodes.label: Office of Land and Emergency Management
nodes.factoid: Manages Superfund hazardous waste cleanups, regulates waste disposal, responds to environmental emergencies, and oversees brownfield redevelopment programs.

nodes.label: Office of Enforcement and Compliance Assurance
nodes.factoid: Investigates environmental violations, enforces EPA regulations, pursues civil and criminal penalties, and ensures compliance with environmental laws nationwide.

subviews.label: Department of Defense Internal Structure
subviews.description: Five military service branches comprising the U.S. Armed Forces under unified Department of Defense command

subviews.label: State Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational bureaus within the Department of State managing diplomacy, consular services, and international affairs

subviews.label: Treasury Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational bureaus within the Department of the Treasury managing tax collection, fiscal operations, and currency production

subviews.label: Department of Justice Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational law enforcement bureaus within the Department of Justice conducting federal investigations and prosecutions

subviews.label: HHS Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational agencies within the Department of Health and Human Services managing public health, healthcare, and medical research

subviews.label: Education Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational offices within the Department of Education managing K-12, higher education, special education, and civil rights programs

subviews.label: Transportation Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational administrations within the Department of Transportation managing highways, transit, aviation, and vehicle safety

subviews.label: Homeland Security Department Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational agencies within the Department of Homeland Security managing emergency response, border security, immigration, and protection services

subviews.label: EPA Internal Structure
subviews.description: Major operational offices within the Environmental Protection Agency managing air quality, water protection, waste cleanup, and enforcement

subviews.label: Federal Executive Agencies
subviews.description: Cabinet-level departments and independent agencies led by presidential appointees.
